result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D Bothe

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order for Inpatient Competency Examination
Proposed Order for Inpatient Competency Examination

[ma] Case called at 10:43 AM 
Defendant Matthew D Bothe appeared by video from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Matthew D Bothe.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

After some discussion with the jail deputy, it is agreed Mr. Bothe will cooperate and be brought to courtroom for proceedings. 
recess: 10:46am--reconvene: 10:50M 

Defendant Matthew D Bothe now appears in person, in custody.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty Rumpf indicates that Defense is in receipt of competency report, and has attempted to review with Mr. Bothe; joins in request for inpatient examination. 
ADA Teuber joins request of evaluator

The Court directs an inpatient evaluation to be conducted; Atty Rumpf to submit order. 

The Court notes Mr. Bothe would prefer to go to Winnebago. 
recess: 10:59AM
NEXT: Status on 11/11/22 at 2:00pm
ec: DA, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI (10/5/22--ma)
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Proposed Order for Competency Evaluation
AMENDED BOND - The amount of $150.00 was previously posted. Therefore, an additional posting of $150.00 is required for release on this bond.

[ml] Case called at 1:42PM
Defendant Matthew D Bothe appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant provides two versions of his current telephone number. Thereafter, Att Nelson advises that the phone number on file should be used, and to contact the Public Defender's Office if contact cannot be established.

The Court requires an additional $150.00 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered [$150.00 already posted, an additional $150.00 is required for release; results in a $300.00 Cash Bond]. 

recess 1:49PM

NEXT: 
(1) Status Conference (competency examination status?) on 10/10 at 10:30AM 
(2) JA - Note in comments that the case is at Prelim stage
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to any Jefferson County Magistrate.

[ml] Case called at 3:37PM
Defendant Matthew D Bothe DOES NOT appear. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in court.
This file is scheduled for a Status Conference as to the status of the competency examination related to the 08/19/2022 correspondence.
Att Rumpf cannot provide an explanation for the Defendant's non-appearance.

On Motion of the State, the Court authorizes and issues a Bench Warrant, Body Only returnable to any Jefferson County Magistrate. 

recess 3:38PM
Letter from Dr. Schoenecker re competency examination
Bond payment information
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
ec: DA, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI (7/15/22--ma)
Proposed Order for Competency Examination

[ma] Case called at 2:03pm [Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing]
Defendant Matthew D Bothe in court, in custody with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Rumpf raises competency. 
The Court orders a competency examination be conducted. 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Bothe committed crimes listed in complaint. 

Atty Rumpf moves for a bond modification
--Arguments given by Counsel

The Court denies request for bond modification.

Mr. Bothe requests of the Court that the Jail permit him to contact his bank during normal business hours; the Court grants this request, directs the Jail to allow Mr. Bothe to make phone call to his bank either today or tomorrow during business hours. 

recess: 2:15pm 
NEXT: Status on 8/29/22 at 3:30pm (outcome of competency examination)
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Amber Rumpf

Conditions of this bond include:
--no presence at the Shell gas station on Church St in Watertown

[ml] Case called at 1:17PM
Defendant Matthew D Bothe appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit as requested by the Defense.

The Court requires a $150.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no presence at the Shell gas station on Church St in Watertown

recess 1:26PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 07/14 at 2:00PM in Branch I
